feed.title: Karthikeyan A K’s blog
feed.subtitle: Hello World, I am Karthikeyan. I eat briyani and worship Boomthata, the creator of God and Satan.

entry.title: Proud of Chennai’s no honking tradition

link.title: Proud of Chennai's no honking tradition

entry.content:
I am born and brought up in Chennai. Yesterday evening I was driving from Medavakkm to Sithalapakkam, and I think I just herd only 1 bike honk, apart from that nothing. For reason unknown, people in Chennai have become civilized and don’t honk as much as say other cities in Tamilnadu or India. Drivers in my city seem to observe the road and drive rather than honk and rush.

Not everyone follows this less, or no honking stuff. Especially people who do not have the privilege to get educated honk a lot, like cab divers, politicians etc, apart from them, and some uncivilized psychopaths, Chennai seems to be slipping into civilized driving culture.

I am not sure how long this will last, or if this culture will improve. Yes, chennai has its challenges, its filthy, its looted by both DMK, and ADMK, left, right and center. Only VIP areas are clean, with stray dogs, and so on, there is rampant use of drugs, and drug related violence, there seems to be a land mafia here, grabbing the lands of innocent. I think recently homicide, and murders have gone up. Yet among this darkness, I notice that Chennai’s roads are getting quieter.

I find that people in the area I grew up, Adyar, exhibit very civilized driving culture. People around OMR too exhibit civilized driving culture. But as you move towards Tambaram, people drive like mad. I am not sure what is the cause of lack of civility?

When I drive, old family members if they travel with me, often ask me, why I am not honking even at turnings, they simply don’t notice that I drastically slow down, observe and turn slow.

Another thing is controllability of vehicles. With modern digital controls, we can control the vehicle in a ways that’s not possible say 15 years ago. Many cars today do not crash. I think all these things are contributing to safer and relaxed driving conditions.

I don’t expect other cities in Tamilnadu, and India to follow Chennai’s example. But I think it’s a good thing that Chennai is not following the example of other cities. I hope that people in Chennai will be more civilized in the future.
entry.summary: I am born and brought up in Chennai. Yesterday evening I was driving from Medavakkm to Sithalapakkam, and I think I just herd only 1 bike honk, apart from that nothing. For reason unknown, people in Chennai have become civilized and don’t honk as much as say other cities in Tamilnadu or India. Drivers in my city seem to observe the road and drive rather than honk and rush.

entry.title: Tamilnadu needs to have dignity temples

link.title: Tamilnadu needs to have dignity temples

entry.content:
Kottravai at Peruvadayar Temple, Thanjavur. Well after the Aryan culture had invaded us.

I was taking a walk in Sithalapakkam today morning, and indignity hit my ears like a sledge hammer, some temple was blasting some Sanskrit chants from it’s speaker. Here we are calling ourselves Tamil’s and we have allowed a invaders language to be used to talk to our Gods. Shame. Why do we call ourselves Tamils then, when we let someone speaks to Gods in an alien language we don’t understand? Why don’t we call ourselves ‘feet lickers of the invaders’?

I am not worried about other civilizations in the Indian subcontinent, I don’t know if they care about, or if they have dignity. If they think their language is good enough to talk to the Gods, and they have shred of their their dignity left, they wouldn’t have allowed Sanskrit to replace it. I don’t think they call themselves dignified people, but we Tamils call ourselves dignified, so I am very much worried about us.

Despite wave after wave of real and soft wars, till today, we have held, we are powerful now than the north. There is no better time to push out the invader’s culture than now. Most of the Tamils who are reading this blog are God believers, you were told to believe, and you believe, leaving out your logic, though, and brain. I do agree, it takes lot of energy to rewire your brain, and if I say don’t believe in God, because it’s spoof, it won’t work. So I am telling to take a step in a direction we could take. We need dignity temples.

So what’s an dignity temple? It’s a temple where the Gods are worshipped in a language we understand, Tamil, and not in an invaders language. It’s a temple that’s open, that is any one can touch our Gods, its not that only some people so called the “elite” are allowed to go near our Gods, and touch it. In this temple, our Gods’s are open to every one. That is even people of different religions like Sikhism, Christianity, Buddhism, Islam can worship our Gods, touch it and give offerings.

We must also revive true Tamil culture. Most of the God now like Vishnu, Pilliyar, Karthikeyan may not be Tamil Gods. Our Gods were Kortavai, Kadal Om, Vel Om etc, which were been morphed by invading cultures. We need to revive these Gods and erect pure Tamil temples. We need historians to probe deep back into our culture and tell who we truly are, so that we can truly revive our Tamil culture, since we are too weak brained to follow the footsteps of Periyaar, and become sane atheists.
entry.summary: Kottravai at Peruvadayar Temple, Thanjavur. Well after the Aryan culture had invaded us.

entry.title: Allah could be Indran
entry.content:
Huubal, the God from which Allah evolved

Muslims around the world worship a single God called Allah. But that was not the case before Islam. Allah was the king of many Gods, Just like God Indran in Hindu Mythology. In fact Indran was once widely worshipped in India, and then I think people cooked up negative stories about him and he lost his fame.

Both Allah and Indran had three daughters. I think in Hinduism, at least two the daughters of Indran, named Devaiyani, and Valli got married to Muruga. Jayanthi was another daughter, by winning over Sooran, I think Jayathi (which means victory, or sometimes birth) became one with Murugan too.

In Christianity, their God is highly forgiving, but in Islam, Allah is very strict, just like Indran.

Allah was once represented by crescent in Arabia, though Islam forbids representation of God, still the pagan way of crescent is used. Even today Muslims worship a stone called Kabha, revolve around a building that houses it in Mecca, all remanence of pagan practices.

Moon in India is called Chandran. Did the ancient Indian the moon worship of Chandran slowly morphed into Indran? Is it Chandran of the Indu’s, which became Indran? Did this Chandran King of Gods move to Arabia and became Allah, the king of Gods there? I don’t know.

If you look at religion and myth, the same stuff would be copied and morphed to fit needs. Take Soora Samharam, and Ramayana, very similar. Jesus is nothing but retold story of Mithra, which appeared in Rome 2000 years prior to Jesus era. As the Jews say, Jesus never existed. Even we have no proof of prophet Mohammed’s existence, and all could have been a spoof to bring people in line to an ideology, align them to a way of life. The concept of heaven and hell were invented by Zoroastrians, and many other religions copied it. Islamist dropped eating pigs to market their religion to the Jews. So nothing is original.

I strongly feel, Allah is nothing but the retold and morphed story of Indran, the king of Gods.
entry.summary: Huubal, the God from which Allah evolved

entry.title: SQL challenge of the day, by Timmy Kurian

link.title: SQL challenge of the day, by Timmy Kurian

entry.content:
Lifted from: Timmy Kurian’s Linkedin

Problem:

Given a table “employees” with columns “employee_id”, “first_name”, “last_name”, “department_id”, and “salary”, return the top 3 employees with the highest salaries for each department.

Sample Tables (CREATE + INSERT):

Query:

Explanation:

This query uses a window function to rank employees within each department by their salary, and then selects only the top 3 employees for each department. This is achieved by using the RANK() function with a PARTITION BY clause, which will reset the ranking for each department. The outer query then filters out any employees with a salary rank higher than 3. This solution allows for ties in salary to be included in the top 3.

entry.title: Taliban India, enslaving 35% of the population

link.title: Taliban India, enslaving 35% of the population

entry.content:
I was out this morning, and noticed that there were many women on street than usual. Thankfully, those women were not doing the useless activity of going to a function, I saw school girls with their moms, waiting for buses, I saw office workers and so on.

Though there were more women than normal, the number of men far exceeded them as usual. So the question here is where are all the women? Locked up I would say. Locked up in their homes by their tradition, by their religion, by their kids, by their husbands, dads, brothers, moms and so on. They simply do not work.

It’s said that somewhat greater than 30% of women in Tamil Nadu work. So if the working population is 100, then 50 are men, other 50 are women. 30% of the 50 is 15, then what happened to the 35% of the women who could work. Locked up! Locked up in their homes like the women of Taliban Afghanistan. Yet we claim our nation to be free and democratic.

Imagine if we can make the 35% work, it could be 35% increase in economy theoretically. Rather than a woman serving tea to her 3 to 5 family members in the morning, if she worked at a tea shop, she could be serving tea for 50 to 250 people. That’s productivity. This might increase number tea shops, reduce cost, give tough to hotels that charge huge amounts for a tea. There would be more labor in the market, more people would be happy to set up businesses because there are more people to work.

I am not sure if right of woman is embedded in Tamil Nadu’s education syllabus. Forget India, under the BJP, it has become a Hindu Talibanic state, we Tamils think and are different. We have empowered our women a bit, but it far too less and not enough. There is a lot of sticky clay in the heads of Tamils too, and we must use education to clean it out of our heads.
entry.summary: I was out this morning, and noticed that there were many women on street than usual. Thankfully, those women were not doing the useless activity of going to a function, I saw school girls with their moms, waiting for buses, I saw office workers and so on.

entry.title: SQL challenge of the day, by Timmy Kurian

link.title: SQL challenge of the day, by Timmy Kurian

entry.content:
Lifted from: Timmy Kurian’s Linkedin

Problem:

Given a table “sales” with columns “customer_id”, “date”, and “amount”, write a query to calculate the 90th percentile of sales for each customer in the year 2021.

Query:

Explanation:

This query uses the PERCENTILE_CONT function to calculate the 90th percentile of sales for each customer in the year 2021. The WITHIN GROUP clause orders the sales amounts for each customer and the WHERE clause filters for the specified year. The result is grouped by customer_id to show the 90th percentile for each customer.

entry.title: SQL challenge of the day, by Timmy Kurian

link.title: SQL challenge of the day, by Timmy Kurian

entry.content:
Lifted from: Timmy Kurian’s Linkedin

Problem:

Given a table of employees with their salaries, find the top 5 highest paid employees in each department.

Sample Tables (CREATE + INSERT):

Query:

Explanation:

This query uses the DENSE_RANK() window function to rank employees within their respective departments based on their salary. It then filters for only the top 5 highest paid employees in each department. This can be useful for identifying top performers or potential discrepancies in salary distribution within a company.

entry.title: SQL challenge of the day, by Timmy Kurian

link.title: SQL challenge of the day, by Timmy Kurian

entry.content:
Lifted from: Timmy Kurian’s Linkedin

Problem:

Given a table of employee sales data, find the top 3 employees with the highest total sales for each month.

Sample Tables (CREATE + INSERT):

Query:

Explanation:

This solution uses a window function to rank the sales for each employee in each month. Then, it selects only the top 3 sales for each month. This is achieved by using the PARTITION BY clause to group the sales by month and the ROW_NUMBER function to assign a rank to each sales record within the month. The results are then filtered to only show the top 3 sales for each month. This can be useful for identifying top-performing employees in each month and tracking their progress over time.

entry.title: Covid, and the lack of data

link.title: Covid, and the lack of data

entry.content:
It was the second covid wave recently. In the first one we had decisive announcement from the government and strict actions were taken. In the second none. Experts were saying covid was spreading, but people behave like fools, like they were immune, as though they had the ultimate control, and as though nothing bad could happen.

To make matters worst, I used to go and sit in my friend’s office because he requested me so, and from their behavior (just by seeing how they approach tech issues), I could infer none would sanitize their hands, none would use masks, the office was packed, filled with non thinkers, ignorance dominated their brains. I feel sorry and not sorry for them. I also knew from the behavior my friend, that he will not declare holiday to slow spread the virus.

What appalled me was the lack of data and information this time. I had to go to X, type “Covid India” in search and try to find out. There were deaths, and there were people who acted as though nothing happened. The government gave no solid information which people could follow. On one hand they said they were ready with beds and oxygen, and on other hand they said that there is nothing to fear. I wondered what’s the truth?

None were following precautions, I think herd immunity saved us this time. I wonder what would have happened if COVID found a new way to kill us all of a sudden. Thankfully it did not happen.

Modi and lack of data

We have a Prime Minister called Modi, who is an illiterate person. I think he himself has admitted that he worked in tea shops. Under his rule, I think the stats department is dysfunctional. Being uneducated and non-intellectual, under his rule, India could have hid true COVID deaths. During the first covid, during the 19’s and 20’s, a lot of people migrated to their hometowns and died on the way. Modi has no data collected about their deaths. We have our leader with such immense stupidity.

Stalin and covid

It was during last COVID, my state chief minister Stalin got elected. You must have seen his election campaign, there would be no COVID precautions. He or his supporters never wore masks. I don’t think anyone sanitized their hands. Yet after winning the elections and becoming the chief minister, he was shameless enough to ask Tamil people to donate money for the governments fight against COVID.

Will we ever have responsible, honest and intelligent politicians?
entry.summary: It was the second covid wave recently. In the first one we had decisive announcement from the government and strict actions were taken. In the second none. Experts were saying covid was spreading, but people behave like fools, like they were immune, as though they had the ultimate control, and as though nothing bad could happen.

entry.content:

Problem:

Given a table of employees with their salaries and department names, calculate the average salary for each department and display the top 5 departments with the highest average salary. Sample Tables (CREATE + INSERT):

Query:

Explanation:

This query uses the AVG() function to calculate the average salary for each department and then uses the ORDER BY and LIMIT keywords to select the top 5 departments with the highest average salary. This can be helpful for companies to identify which departments may need salary adjustments to stay competitive in the market.
